item.title: Pokemon GO Leak Reveals New Info About Necrozma's Debut
item.description:
Highlights

  • Players will soon be able to catch Necrozma in Pokemon GO, and a leak has revealed that its fusions will be available.
  • Specifically, players will be able to fuse Necrozma with Solgaleo and Lunala to access Necrozma's alternate forms like Dusk Mane and Dawn Wings.
  • However, questions remain about the permanence of fusion, its costs, and shiny requirements.

A Pokemon GO leak has revealed that Necrozma's fusions will be available in the game. Pokemon GO has 61 Legendary monsters in its Pokedex, and players can catch most of them in 5-star Raids. The list of Legendary Pokemon available in the game will soon increase with the addition of Necrozma, one of the critters featured in Gen 7.

Necrozma has a vaguely humanoid appearance, and its body is made from a black crystalline material. The Psychic-type Pokemon is the cover mascot for Pokemon Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon , and together with Solgaleo and Lunala forms the "Light trio." After leaks teased the addition of the Legendary to the augmented reality game, Niantic later confirmed that Necrozma is coming to Pokemon GO . But while Necrozma will debut at Pokemon GO Fest 2024's Raids, players have not known many details beyond that. Now, a new Pokemon GO leak has been shared that reveals exciting information about Necrozma's arrival.

Related
New Pokemon Go Player Reaches Level 50 in Incredibly Short Amount of Time
A Pokemon GO player reaches the coveted level 50, and impresses other trainers by revealing how quickly they achieved this feat.

Reddit user Pokeradar posted a Pokemon GO leak revealing that it will be possible to fuse Necrozma with Solgaleo and Lunala. The images show Necrozma in its regular form, with a "Fusion" button below "Power Up." Next, the Pokemon GO leak shows the fusion of Necrozma and Lunala, and where the Fusion button used to appear, the "Unfusion" is available. The same goes for the powerful Legendary Solgaleo , with more images showing its fusion with Necrozma, and the same button to undo the fusion.

Leak Teases the Addition of Necrozma's Alternate Forms in Pokemon GO

Although Necrozma doesn't evolve from or into any Pokemon, the Legendary has three alternative forms. When fused with Solgaleo, the Pokemon transforms into Dusk Mane Necrozma, becoming a Psychic/Steel-type. Fusing with Lunala transforms the Pokemon into the Psychic/Ghost-type called Dawn Wings Necrozma. The antagonist of Pokemon Ultra Sun and Moon turns into Ultra Necrozma when Dusk Mane or Dawn Wings Necrozma holds Ultranecrozium Z and uses Ultra Burst. Since it will be necessary to have Solgaleo and Lunalato to unlock Necrozma's alternate forms, a Redditor commented in the post speculating on whether the Legendary duo could eventually have Raids at the GO Fest 2024.

The addition of Necrozma's fusion mechanic to Pokemon GO is exciting information, but it comes with a few questions. The leak doesn't reveal whether the fusion between Necrozma and Solgaleo/Lunala is permanent or temporary, and in the case of a reversal, there is no information on whether there is a cost in materials to do so. Another point is that the leak doesn't reveal what happens to the stats of the fused Pokemon , or whether fusing a shiny Necrozma will require a shiny Solgaleo/Lunala. With some time left until the start of Pokemon GO Fest 2024, the expectation is that new information will appear before then.

item.title: New Pokemon GO Update Makes It Extremely Hard To Catch Pokemon
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon GO's latest update has caused major glitches, making it hard for fans to catch Pokemon and participate in the Battle League.
  • Players have found workarounds for the issues, like turning off native refresh rate or reducing phone refresh rate.
  • The bugs seem to be affecting Android users and not iOS users, impacting gameplay and putting Android players at a disadvantage.

Pokemon GO 's recent update has turned out to be a nightmare for fans, as many are unable to catch Pokemon at all due to the glitches. That's not all, either, as the framerate issues have also made it extremely difficult for players to take part in the Pokemon GO Battle League, putting them at a significant disadvantage.

Pokemon GO 's World of Wonders season has received a vitriolic response from the community so far. While the season started off on a high with some exciting events, things have gone downhill in the past few weeks with the release of Pokemon GO 's controversial Avatar update . Not only are many fans still unable to make peace with the revamped avatars, it seems like yet another issue has cropped up in the game.

Related
Pokemon GO Bringing Back Master Ball in Upcoming Event
The Master Ball is back in a new Pokemon GO event, and players will have the chance to obtain the powerful item over the next few weeks.

In a new post on the Pokemon GO subreddit, user CQTee highlights the issues players have been facing after updating the game to the latest version. Players who want to play the game at 60 FPS or above need to use the Native Refresh Rate option in Pokemon GO . However, after the update, this option seems to be causing a lot of glitches, with the ball resetting at its original position at times, effectively making it impossible to catch Pokemon. Additionally, players highlighted that they have been struggling to even hit Pokemon with their Pokeballs after the update, with excellent and curveball throws in Pokemon GO going outside the screen completely.

Pokemon GO Player Finds Workaround To Fix New Update Glitch

Thankfully, players have found a workaround for this. While not updating the game is one way to not face the issues, the original poster highlights that turning off the native refresh rate seems to alleviate some of the issues users are facing. Additionally, another user highlights that reducing the refresh rate of the phone seems to do the trick as well. So, if a phone supports a 120Hz refresh rate, then dropping it to 60Hz with the Native Refresh Rate turned on in Pokemon GO should work. However, for 60Hz phones, turning it off completely seems to be the only fix.

It is interesting to note that this issue seems to be affecting Android users only, as iOS users haven't reported any issues so far. However, the bugs seem to expand beyond just catching Pokemon, as others have highlighted that GO Battle League is marred with glitches too. Apart from the framerate drops, Pokemon GO is unable to register fast moves at times, putting the players at a disadvantage against their opponents. Considering that this coincides with a number of exciting events in Pokemon GO such as the GO Battle Weekend , it remains to be seen whether Niantic compensates fans for the issues they have been facing lately.

item.title: Fallout 4 Player Beats the Game Using Only a Rolling Pin
item.description:
Highlights

  • Talented Fallout 4 YouTuber Nerbit beats the game using only a rolling pin as a weapon.
  • Some gamers seek challenges by imposing restrictions on themselves for playthroughs.
  • YouTuber Nerbit showcases expertise in several different Bethesda titles through these kinds of challenge runs.

A talented Fallout 4 player has managed to complete an entire playthrough of the game using only a rolling pin as a weapon. Fallout 4 offers players many ways to complete the game, although it has to be said that this particular gamer has made things much more difficult for themselves.

As with any Bethesda game, Fallout 4 massively encourages repeat playthroughs. Some players play the same way every single time, while others just make a few different choices here and there. However, some players will place restrictions on themselves on purpose in order to make it a much more difficult challenge. Through the power of modding, one gamer even managed to beat Fallout 4 playing as a radscorpion . Seeing these types of challenge runs come to fruition is always fascinating, as they often require a ton of patience, especially when things aren’t exactly going to plan.

Related
Fallout Fan Creates Amazing Glass Trinkets Based on Iconic Items
A creative Fallout fan online shares their amazing glass trinkets, made to resemble a few of the iconic items as they appear in the games.

YouTuber Nerbit shared their unique run of Fallout 4 , in which they beat the game using only the rolling pin in combat. It isn’t exactly one of the best melee weapons in Fallout 4 , so it’s certainly an interesting choice. The run is inspired by one of Nerbit’s previous videos, in which he beats Fallout: New Vegas using the same weapon. This time around, Nerbit follows the Railroad storyline of the game, taking down both the Institute and Brotherhood of Steel using only a rolling pin, which he finds at the very beginning of Fallout 4 .

Beating Fallout 4 With Only a Rolling Pin

Nerbit has established himself as quite the expert at Bethesda challenge runs. Last year, he completed a run of Fallout: New Vegas while roleplaying as Ronald Reagan , and has done several other runs of various Bethesda titles under similar rule sets. While comedy is definitely the main intention of these runs, it’s interesting to see how he navigates the actual issues the game puts in the way of players along the way. While it isn’t clear what Nerbit has planned next, it’s certain to be an awesome challenge.

While players are still completing unique playthroughs of Fallout 4 , there’s no doubt an appetite for a new single-player title in the series, at this point. This desire has only intensified in the wake of the Fallout TV show’s success. Recently, Todd Howard revealed that Bethesda wants to release games at a quicker rate , so this may be something that eventually comes to fruition. Even with this in mind, the development of The Elder Scrolls 6 means news of a new Fallout is unlikely for a little while yet.

item.title: Hilarious Baldur’s Gate 3 Build Turns Tav Into It’s Always Sunny’s Frank Reynolds
item.description:
Highlights

  • A Redditor has turned their Baldur's Gate 3 character into It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia's Frank Reynolds.
  • The hilarious Baldur's Gate 3 build also uses hirelings to depict the other main characters from the TV show.

A Baldur’s Gate 3 player has shared their hilarious build, which turns their Dark Urge character into It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia ’s Frank Reynolds. Since Baldur’s Gate 3 ’s release last year, players have been using the character creator to bring a ton of unique builds to life.

One of the most interesting things about Baldur’s Gate 3 has been seeing what creative players have been able to achieve using the character creator. Some players can spend hours crafting their perfect character, while others use it to create their favorites from other franchises, too. One recent Baldur’s Gate 3 build even turned Tav into Ahsoka Tano from Star Wars , but that’s just the tip of the iceberg of what players have been creating over the last few months. The versatility of the character creator is massive, hence why players have been able to put together such amazing builds.

Related
Why Baldur's Gate 3's Most Loved Feature Could Never Work in Tabletop
There's one part of Baldur's Gate 3 that players love, but it's an aspect that translates poorly back into Dungeons and Dragons.

Redditor spriggleporp shared their amazing Baldur’s Gate 3 build online, turning their party into the cast of It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia . Their Dark Urge protagonist is Frank Reynolds, a dwarf warlock. Meanwhile, they have recruited a series of hirelings to fill out their party, with Mac, Charlie, and Dennis all represented. Finally, they have also brought a raven along for the journey, with Dee being described as a bird frequently throughout the show. It’s definitely a party build that all fans of It’s Always Sunny in Philadelphia can appreciate for its ingenuity.

Baldur's Gate 3 It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia Build

As part of the build, spriggleporp has clearly made an effort to match some of the attributes with the character's traits. For example, Mac's character has 19 Dexterity, giving him better agility during combat. Others in the thread posed their own ideas about how this Baldur's Gate 3 build could be improved, with one player suggesting they make Dennis a golden god. However, the original poster responded, clarifying that because they're playing on console, they don't have access to any Baldur's Gate 3 mods , limiting what's possible with these builds to the base game.

Beyond bug fixes to Baldur's Gate 3 , it seems that Larian has now fully moved on from the franchise. There's no doubt that the talent of the developer in crafting CRPGs is one of the biggest reasons that Baldur's Gate 3 was as big a success as it was, and it'll be fascinating to see how the series fares without the studio. Hasbro has already confirmed that a Baldur's Gate 4 is on the way , although whenever it does happen, it will always be compared to the title that came before.

item.title: Insomniac Developer Shares Unused Venom Animation From Marvel's Spider-Man 2
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fans are impressed with an unused Venom traversal animation from Marvel's Spider-Man 2.
  • In the footage, Venom moves around in his liquid form before turning into the solid monstrous creature players expect to see.
  • The unreleased Venom footage has sparked debate among fans, with fans divided on its potential and some gamers thinking the concept was cooler than the final product.

An Insomniac Games developer has shared an unused piece of animation from Marvel's Spider-Man 2 pertaining to the game's iconic antagonist, Venom. Despite not making it to the final version of Marvel's Spider-Man 2 , fans are quite impressed with how good the animation is.

With Venom having his own fan base far before the release of Marvel's Spider-Man 2 , expectations were high for Insomniac Games' portrayal of the symbiote. The fact that the Marvel's Spider-Man 2 community was yearning to get more playtime as Venom speaks volumes about how fans feel about the game's take on the character. However, it seems like there was a slightly different variant of Venom which Insomniac Games had initially designed, and it has left fans in a dilemma.

Related
Marvel's Spider-Man 2's Version of Venom is Making His Comic Book Debut This Year
Marvel's Spider-Man 2's altered take on Venom is making his comic book debut in an upcoming multiverse crossover event later this year.

In a new tweet, Insomniac Games' Advanced Senior Animator Liam Murphy shared an interesting video from the pre-release version of the game. The post showcases a much different version of Venom from what players saw in the game, with more of a goopy appearance.

Marvel's Spider-Man 2 Unreleased Venom Footage Sparks Missed Potential Debate Again

While players can travel short distances while briefly controlling Venom in Marvel's Spider-Man 2 , what makes this animation stand out is that it fits in intrinsically with Venom's overall attributes and takes him to the streets of New York. In the video, Venom moves across a road while the Symbiote is still in its liquid form, which gives the traversal a really slick appearance. The way Venom regains his form toward the end of the footage is equally satisfying to watch.

As Liam highlights, this animation over five years old and was one of the first proof-of-concepts Insomniac designed. Considering that Insomniac started working on the sequel after the DLC for the first game, it seems like this is probably one of the oldest pre-release videos of Marvel's Spider-Man 2 . Liam further adds that the 2D animation was done in Photoshop, by drawing on top of an existing imported video.

This footage has sparked a fresh debate in the community, with some feeling that Marvel's Spider-Man 2 was a bit rushed and had a lot of missed potential . Over on Reddit, critical fans were quite surprised that this concept was scrapped, believing that it looks cooler than the release version. In fact, the unfinished nature of the video adds a really interesting layer to the animation, with many drawing parallels to the Spider-Verse movie franchise's art style. While the community is still split over whether the concept or final version of Venom is better, a common consensus among the community seems to be that the developers might end up using this movement idea for the leaked Venom spin-off game.
